thread.title: Villagers set up langars for protesters
thread.title_full: Villagers set up langars for protesters

author: tribuneindia.com
title: Villagers set up langars for protesters
text:
Chandigarh, October 11
Agitating farmers in Punjab may have earned the wrath of the Railways, the authorities and passengers for disrupting the train movement, but their stir has got support from the villagers who are feeding a large number of protesters squatting on rail tracks. Villagers have set up community kitchens (langar) near protesting points to feed the agitating farmers. “There is no worry for food. People from adjoining villages are giving us food,” BKU Etka (Dakunda) General Secretary Jagmohan Singh said today. As nights are becoming colder, protesting farmers in Nabha were given 200 blankets by volunteers of a nearby gurdwara, said Singh. — PTI
